column4: Anyhow, does  ANYONE:  looking for link for "how to" videos in ubuntu linux.  ideas?  i saw a bunch were posted but forgot where
i'm looking for the link i saw on one of the ubuntu pages, Nikyo .  thanks though
can i ask if anyone knows of a applet similiar to weather applet?
the weather applet uses evaporation, rainfall, wind and sunlight to gauge ET value (how much to water yard)
if there isn't one taht would one would ROCK.  values are easy to get off weather.com
the one built in Gnome 2 with the date and time
or the one, that omgubuntu people have been working on?
since this silly idea to replace the Gnome clock in 10.10
there is a weather applet that is currently being  developed,  maybe thats what your on about
i don't know about the developement
your on about the one that comes with Gnome and Ubuntu at the moment yeah?

and a calender, on the top right of the panel,  well  thats going to be replaced,  with a clock that Canonical have made for 10.10, and so some guys worked on a weather applet,  and i'll get you a link
I don't know if it will become an offical part of Ubuntu 10.10 or not, but if it doesn't already have it, and you get in contact with them, they can probably program in features you want
